elevator.rmi
Class ScalesImpl

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
        |
        +--java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
              |
              +--java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
                    |
                    +--elevator.rmi.ScalesImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.rmi.Remote, Scales, java.io.Serializable
public class ScalesImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Scales

The class ScalesImpl implements the remote interface elevator.rmi.Scales used for controlling floor indicators (scales) of elevators via RMI. An object with the ScalesImpl class is created to set (or to get) values to the scales of elevators. The elevator.rmi.Scales interface can be used to set or get value of scales of all elevators at once, a group of elevators or one elevator. The getScales() static method of the elevator.rmi.MakeAll class is invoked to get a remote reference to the elevator.rmi.Scales object. For example: 

     MakeAll.init(localhost);
     ...
    Scales scales = MakeAll.getScales();
    Motors motors = MakeAll.getMotors();
    int[] where = (int[])motors.whereAre();
    scales.setScalePosition(where);

Version:
1.0
Author:
Vlad Vlassov, IMIT/KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
See Also:
MakeAll, Scale, Serialized Form

setScalePosition in interface Scales
